intro: Spigelia scabrella, commonly known as the rough spigelia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and Georgia. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of red, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are oval-shaped and have a rough texture, giving the plant its common name. Spigelia scabrella is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and hammocks.
